DataElement.preferredName: Third Sitting Arm Mercury Sphyg Systolic Result in Millimeter of Mercury Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric result of the third measurement of a participant's systolic blood pressure; at the conclusion of the second measurement the measurement arm is raised 5 seconds, and then there is an additional 25 second wait with the same arm on a table, legs uncrossed and feet on the ground, head supported and participant comfortable.  While slowly deflating the cuff, the first sound heard in a series of at least two sounds is recorded as the systolic blood pressure, in mmHg to the nearest even number.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Third Sitting Arm Mercury Sphyg Systolic Pressure Measurement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Third measurement of a participant's systolic blood pressure; at the conclusion of the second measurement the measurement arm is raised 5 seconds, and then there is an additional 25 second wait with the same arm on a table.  While slowly deflating the cuff, the first sound heard in a series of at least two sounds is recorded as the systolic blood pressure, in mmHg to the nearest even number.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Third Sitting position Arm Mercury sphygmomanometer Systolic Pressure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Following the second position in an ordering or series.:No value exists.:Technically the part of the superior limb between the shoulder and the elbow but commonly used to refer to the whole superior limb.:Sphygmomanometers that consist of an inflatable cuff that fits around the arm, a bulb for controlling the air pressure within the cuff, and a mercury manometer.:the blood pressure during the contraction of the left ventricle of the heart.

Concepts.definition: Following the second position in an ordering or series; coming next after the second and just before the fourth in position.
The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb.
Sphygmomanometers that consist of an inflatable cuff that fits around the arm, a bulb for controlling the air pressure within the cuff, and a mercury manometer.
the blood pressure during the contraction of the left ventricle of the heart.

Property.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Blood Pressure Result in Millimeter of Mercury Number
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Result of a diastolic or systolic blood pressure reading, expressed as a numeric value in millimeters of mercury (mmHg) to the nearest even number.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

DataElement.changeDescription: CDE based on the ABI manual specifications for the ARIC study.
